result.title: Bitwise ~ operator doubt
result.content:
int main() 
{
	//Beauty is in relaxed hard work.
	//SSGCA :)
	//Keep doing your thing, complexity would turn into simplicity! :)
    unsigned short int a=0xffff; 
    ~a;
    printf("%x",a);
	return 0;
}

Why does this program output 'ffff' and not 0000?
